metadata.title: Effect of the Ebola-virus-disease epidemic on malaria case management in Guinea, 2014: a cross-sectional survey of health facilities

abstract.original_text: Background-The ongoing west Africa Ebola-virus-disease epidemic has disrupted the entire health-care system in affected countries. Because of the overlap of symptoms of Ebola virus disease and malaria, the care delivery of malaria is particularly sensitive to the indirect effects of the current Ebola-virus-disease epidemic. We therefore characterise malaria case management in the context of the Ebola-virus-disease epidemic and document the effect of the Ebola-virusdisease epidemic on malaria case management.

sentences.segment_text: Background-The ongoing west Africa Ebola-virus-disease epidemic has disrupted the entire health-care system in affected countries .
Because of the overlap of symptoms of Ebola virus disease and malaria ,
the care delivery of malaria is particularly sensitive to the indirect effects of the current Ebola-virus-disease epidemic .
We therefore characterise malaria case management in the context of the Ebola-virus-disease epidemic and document the effect of the Ebola-virusdisease epidemic on malaria case management .
